Posts.Content: Hi sazza, glad ur being able to keep busy and staying positive. I'm going from one emotion to another constantly I always worry way ages of myself with everything And can't seem to keep it under control for most of the day. Reading all the other ladies tips on relaxing is helping so hopefully will help you to x
Posts.Title: Really scared

Posts.Content: Hi I have already done that and this helps for a while, slept not to bad and woke early struggling with it all again hopefully today will be a better one. Thank you xxx
Posts.Title: Really scared

Posts.Content: Thank you kazzie, thinking of you to just finding it really hard to deal with all this pushing everyone away then feeling guilty about that, and just don't no how to feel positive when I'm so scared. Good luck to you to Joanne xxx
Posts.Title: Really scared

Posts.Content: Hi I had the biopsy of the lump and one lymph node the lymph node the lump came back positive and the lymph node negative. So as far as I'm aware they will take the lump check more lymph nodes then I'll have to wait another few days again to see if they have to do anything else. It's all this waiting that is making me so anxious I don't no how I'm going to cope.
Posts.Title: Really scared

Posts.Content: Hi Lisa all this is rubbish I am mostly thinking about my family and friend and and what they must be going through and how seeing me walk about like a rabbit caught in the headlights. Must be terrifying them. The thing is I want to ask questions but the I'm terrified of the answers I just need to try and find the strength from somwere. Joanne xxx
Posts.Title: Really scared

Posts.Content: Hi Jackie and George, Thank you for the information, I think because I am so scared of the outcome after the surgery on Wednesday I am so scared to even open my mouth or even look at my Little boy as he will straight away sense my fear. I feel like I'm totally loosing it today I'm pushing all my family away and just constantly being on here, but no that I can't sit like this for the sake of my sons and family but don't no how to get out of my head with this fear and function properly :-( Joanne xxxx
Posts.Title: Really scared

Posts.Content: Thank you Lisa yes I know what you mean it's the fear of what you have in ur own head that you don't want your family having the same fears and at the moment I'm scared of asking questions as all I am scared about is death and don't want my children 10 and twins 20 to be thinking the same or my husband and family, don't think I said my age I'm 38. I'm goin to go out with my mum for a bit so hopefully I will calm down for a while. Thank you everyone for your support and hope wish you all well And hope you don't mind me talking when i feel I have to. Joanne xxx
Posts.Title: Really scared

Posts.Content: Thank you Wendy and Ethel I only hope I can find the courage and motivation that you both had I no I am only at the beginning of this and that's wat terrifies me that if I'm not coping now how am I going to do it as it goes along, as like any mother my kids are my life and always the most important thing to you, I don't no how to put myself first, and this sitting in my head wracked with worry and not being able to concentrate on anything else other than what's going to happen to me is making me feel so guilty for not being the mum and wife that I normally am. Joanne xxxx
Posts.Title: Really scared

Posts.Content: Thank you jane I will do my best to try that, I have just left the house for a drive I hope this helps to get my head together a but more Joanne xxx
Posts.Title: Really scared

Posts.Content: I have just been told 2 days ago my lump in my breast is cancer and having operation next Wednesday I am so scared in shock and can't believe I am actually on here I just feel I need to speak to people in the same position even though I have amazing family and friends, I am finding it really difficult to stay calm. Joanne
Posts.Title: Really scared

Posts.Content: Hi jane, as far as I know they biopsies one of the nodes that looked a bit suspect on the scan and they said it was ok, but I think they said they will still take some for testing when they do the surgery. Thank you for replying Jane xxx
Posts.Title: Really scared

Posts.Content: Hi Marilyn I know exactly how you feel it has all happend so fast and still can't believe that I'm actually saying to people I have breast cancer I feel so alienated and I'm putting my poor family through the mill with my emotions all over the place, I can't really remember much of what the doctor said and everything in my mind just keeps going back to worst case scenario. This has helped a bit the last day but still really struggling to get out my head and stop worrying. Maybe we could help each other if you need to talk I will probably be checking on here quite often. Take care Joanne xxx
Posts.Title: Really scared

Posts.Content: Hi wendi Thank you for your kind words and your story And that you are all at the other end now. Well done for your bravery I only hope I can find the same strength as you. At the moment I'm going from feeling sorry for me, for my kids and family, then feeling guilty that I'm not just getting up and being as normal as I can for especially my 10 year old son. We havnt told him anything yet really don't want him to hear that word. Thank you wendi xxx
Posts.Title: Really scared

Posts.Content: Surgery in the morning really scared, then have to wait a week for results just want them to tell me this is your treatment and your going to be ok don't no how I'm going to cope with all this waiting and if there's more surgery. Can't get out my head with dread and fear or function properly Just need answers and some reassurance I no I can't get :-( xxx
Posts.Title: Really scared

Posts.Content: Hi angel, I am in the same position as you waiting to get my lump removed on wed then another wait, I feel like I'm going stir crazy with all the worry, and even tho like you I have three boys a husband and my mum and sisters at home all sitting waiting to comfort me I have left the house for a drive and feeling alone just as you are. I feel like I am already holding onto this website to keep my sanity, and it is helping a bit. I don't no how to add friends or anything yet but if you do you could add me and maybe we could help each other. Joanne xxx
Posts.Title: feel alone

Posts.Content: Here I am again two days after lumpectomy and sentinel mode removed pain is ok is it normal for the area to be numb? I havnt slept for three days tablets the doctor gave me not calmin me down feel like I'm going out my mind and just need to talk to people all the time, don't no how I'm going to get through the next 5 days till results then treatment. Sorry for sounding so desperate Joanne xxx
Posts.Title: Sleepless nights

Posts.Content: Hi I'm two weeks past surgery, (lumpectomy snl removal) waiting on app to about chemo, I feel so scared numb and alone and always looking for an answer or assurance that I'm going to be ok. I just feel totally lost and emotionally shut down :-( xxx
Posts.Title: Feel so alone

Posts.Content: Thank you Rebecca I keep trying to tell myself that and to stop sitting on the sofa with all these morbid thoughts, and even though the doctors have said it's all out still keep looking at my breast and panicking about everything xxxx
Posts.Title: Feel so alone
